title.narrative: The Danish Gulf of Guinea Maritime Security Programme phase II, 2019-2021

description.narrative: Strengthened national and regional maritime law response to piracy Maritime strategies in place in Ghana and Nigeria Research informed regional dialogue and capacity development Maritime operational planning and response enhanced to counter piracy in the Gulf of Guinea

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

mailing-address.narrative: Dr. Isert Road 67, (8th Avenue Extension) North Ridge

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Output 1.1: A comprehensive National Integrated Maritime Strategy (NIMS) fully endorsed by the Ghanaian Government
Number of reports provided by national authority on the development and endorsement of maritime strategy
Output 1.2: A comprehensive national maritime strategy developed and fully endorsed by the Nigerian Government
Number of reports provided by national authority on the development and endorsement of maritime strategy
Outcome 1: National maritime strategies to ensure maritime security in Ghana and Nigeria developed and endorsed in accordance with African Union and ECOWAS Integrated Maritime Strategy
Number of maritime strategies and inter-agency collaboration in place
Output 2.1: Implementation plans to strengthen the framework of maritime governance, and to ensure the safety and security of Nigeria’s maritime domain developed and adopted
Number of research analysis, coordination and validation meeting
Output 2.2: Implementation plan to promote capacity-building, research, awareness and knowledge-sharing in Nigeria developed and adopted
Number of research analysis, coordination and validation meeting
Output 2.3: Implementation plan to develop dynamic and diversified regional and international cooperation in line with ECOWAS Integrated Maritime Strategy developed and adopted
Number of research analysis, coordination and validation meeting
Outcome 3: The National Integrated Maritime Strategy supported (through the development of implementation plans) ensuring a safe and secure Ghana’s maritime domain
Number of implementation plans developed in accordance with NIMS as well as African Union and ECOWAS Integrated Maritime Strategy
Outcome 2: The National Maritime Strategy supported (through the development of implementation plans) ensuring a safe and secure Nigerian’s maritime domain
Number of implementation plans developed in accordance with national maritime strategies as well as African Union and ECOWAS Integrated Maritime Strategy
Outcome 4: Implementation plans successfully monitored and evaluated to improve the achievement of strategic objectives of national maritime strategies
Number of programme and policy recommendations in delivering implementation plans developed under the Outcomes 2 and 3
Output 3.1: Implementation plans to strengthen the framework of maritime governance and to ensure the safety and security of Ghana's maritime domain developed and adopted
Number of research analysis, coordination and validation meeting

target.value: 2 Research analysis, coordination meeting minutes and validation report available and endorsed

actual.value: A total of 6 implementation plans (IPs) were developed, where 2 was planned in the programme. The IPs were validated by national counterparts including the Security Governance Initiative in Ghana.

target.value: Research analysis, coordination meeting minutes and validation report available

actual.value: Implementation plans couldn’t be developed during the reporting period as the final version of NIMS was not yet fully drafted due to the sensitivities of the Presidential Election in Ghana in December 2020.

title.narrative: Output 4.1: Monitoring and evaluation of implementation plans of Ghanaian National Integrated Maritime Strategy (NIMS) ensured
Number of mechanism to monitor and evaluate the implementation plans, as well as number of quarterly coordination meeting reports

actual.value: M&E mechanism development not initiated, as the Ghanaian National Integrated Strategy hadn't been endorsed.

target.value: M&E mechanism developed, and 4 quarterly coordination meeting reports available

actual.value: M&E mechanism development not initiated, as the Nigerian Maritime Strategy hadn't been endorsed and operationalized. No M&E mechanism developed as the strategies are not endorsed and operationalized. Yet, the increased number of IPs developed served a purpose more relevant for the operationalization of the strategies than an M&E tool would have done given the delayed process of endorsement.

title.narrative: Output 4.2: Monitoring and evaluation of implementation plans of Nigerian Maritime Strategy ensured
Number of mechanism to monitor and evaluate the implementation plans, as well as number of quarterly coordination meeting reports

target.value: M&E mechanism developed, and 4 quarterly coordination meeting reports available

actual.value: M&E mechanism development not initiated, as the Nigerian Maritime Strategy hadn't been endorsed and operationalized. No M&E mechanism developed as the strategies are not endorsed and operationalized. Yet, the increased number of IPs developed served a purpose more relevant for the operationalization of the strategies than an M&E tool would have done given the delayed process of endorsement.
M&E mechanism development not initiated, as the Nigerian Maritime Strategy hadn't been endorsed.
